segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing in the puddle, and she doesn’t even seem to feel it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is going to be ruined, and she’s just drying dishes like it’s normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, I’m surprised he hasn’t fallen yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a mess, and no one is paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is while the kitchen is flooding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is getting closer to the children, and they don’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the water before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is just frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
